title: Can anyone explain what happened to junglers this season?
body:
For years they've focused bot almost exclusively.

They put IMPORTANT DRAGONS bot lane, and i am now averaging one jungler that focuses bot every 20 games maximum.

Enemy jungler is always on it though, is everyone i'm against duoing with a not braindead jungler or am i still on the 10 years of statistically almost impossible luck that i've been having?

replies.body: Nothing more breaks my heart when dragon is about to be respawn and my jungle goes to the other side of the map to farm camps.

> [{quoted}](name=only luciano,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=X0AEEuWK,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-12-10T05:27:36.712+0000)
>
> Nothing more breaks my heart when dragon is about to be respawn and my jungle goes to the other side of the map to farm camps.

Nothing breaks mine more then seeing my entire team ignore a free dragon. Get a triple kill, or watch 2-3 enemies recall, and they would still rather farm lane instead of getting it with no contest. Stupidity is a 2 way street.
I say, a failing jungler is the worst asset you can have in pickscreen this patch.

> [{quoted}](name=Zeppelins circus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=X0AEEuWK,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-12-10T04:21:18.303+0000)
>
> I say, a failing jungler is the worst asset you can have in pickscreen this patch.

I honestly wish I was just being dramatic and my junglers were the better jungler 50% of the time, i'd probably win more like 75% of games if this was the case.

If the enemy jungle is on dragon and you aren't in a position to stop them, that means you're also not in a position to stop the enemy bottom lane from stopping your jungle. And that's not even considering whether mid lane has priority, or which jungle wins the 1v1.

This is some weird low elo shit where nobody understands how the game works. If dragon spawns, neither your mid nor bottom have priority, and your champion doesn't win a duel against the enemy jungle, then you can't contest it and there's literally no reason to be around dragon vs. doing something more useful elsewhere.

> [{quoted}](name=Yenn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=X0AEEuWK,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-12-11T03:17:52.044+0000)
>
> If the enemy jungle is on dragon and you aren't in a position to stop them, that means you're also not in a position to stop the enemy bottom lane from stopping your jungle. And that's not even considering whether mid lane has priority, or which jungle wins the 1v1.
> 
> This is some weird low elo shit where nobody understands how the game works. If dragon spawns, neither your mid nor bottom have priority, and your champion doesn't win a duel against the enemy jungle, then you can't contest it and there's literally no reason to be around dragon vs. doing something more useful elsewhere.

You're creating a scenario that doesn't exist...I'm talking about Junlgers that don't take advantage of lane position, don't gank for lanes that are shoved in, generally hang around top side, trying to gank when there's nothing there, getting double killed while tower diving with their "Bud" 

I would be happy if when i am keeping a 4-5 minute freeze if they'd come and help zone them off it or kill them and then walk over to dragon with us

you can't say there's "nothing there" when a dragon is there

Players would ACTUALLY HAVE nothing there and camp bot relentlessly and have for years, the SECOND you put IMPORTANT dragons there, no junlger under diamond will fucking go near bot side, even when ADC is decently strong and it is well known that playing botside wins games, they're just in the mood to do anything but go bot ever.

Do you even read what you write??

"Enemy jungler is always on it though..."

Statistically that is impossible.
If you play solo you are the only constant in your games.

> [{quoted}](name=BigFBear,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=X0AEEuWK,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-12-10T05:41:57.415+0000)
>
> Do you even read what you write??
> 
> "Enemy jungler is always on it though..."
> 
> Statistically that is impossible.
> If you play solo you are the only constant in your games.

go right ahead and look at my match history, if you can find 50% of my junglers being even or positive KDA or having any statistics that would hint they were comparable to the enemy jungler, or better, i will retract my statement AND tell you that you were right and I was wrong.
This is called the inverse shaco principle.
